workflow.name: Smart Facebook Messenger Chatbot with Gemini AI, Message Batching and History
workflow.description:
## ü§ñ Facebook Messenger Smart Chatbot ‚Äì Batch, Format & Notify with n8n Data Table  
### by Nguyen Thieu Toan

### üåü What Is This Workflow?

This is a smart chatbot solution built with n8n, designed to integrate seamlessly with Facebook Messenger. It batches incoming messages, formats them for clarity, tracks conversation history, and sends natural replies using AI. Perfect for businesses, customer support, or personal AI agents.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Features

- üîÑ **Smart batching**: Groups consecutive user messages to process them in one go, avoiding fragmented replies.
- üß† **Context formatting**: Automatically formats messages to fit Messenger‚Äôs structure and length limits.
- üìã **Conversation history tracking**: Stores and retrieves chat logs between user and bot using n8n Data Table.
- üëÄ **Seen & Typing effects**: Adds human-like responsiveness with Messenger‚Äôs sender actions.
- üß© **AI Agent integration**: Easily connects to GPT, Gemini, or any LLM for natural replies, scheduling, or business logic.

---

### üöÄ How It Works

1. Connects to your Facebook Page via webhook to receive and send messages.
2. Stores incoming messages in a Data Table called `Batch_messages`, including fields like `user_text`, `bot_rep`, `processed`, etc.
3. Collects unprocessed messages, sorts them by `id`, and creates a `merged_message` and full `history`.
4. Sends the `history` to an AI Agent for contextual response generation.
5. Sends the AI reply back to Messenger with Seen/Typing effects.
6. Updates the message status to `processed = true` to prevent duplicate handling.

---

### üõ†Ô∏è Setup Guide

- Create a Facebook App and Messenger webhook, link it to your Page.
- Set up the `Batch_messages` Data Table in n8n with required columns.
- Import the workflow or build nodes manually using the tutorial.
- Configure your API tokens, webhook URLs, and AI Agent endpoint.
- Deploy the workflow on a public n8n server.

üìò Full tutorial available at:  
üëâ [Smart Chatbot Workflow Guide by Nguyen Thieu Toan](https://nguyenthieutoan.com/share-n8n-workflow-facebook-messenger-smart-chatbot-use-message-batching-table-data)

---

### üí° Pro Tips

- Customize the AI prompt and persona to match your business tone.
- Add scheduling, lead capture, or CRM integration using n8n‚Äôs flexible nodes.
- Monitor your Data Table regularly to ensure clean message flow and batching.

---

### üë§ About the Creator

**Nguyen Thieu Toan (Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n/Jay Nguyen)** is an expert in AI automation, business optimization, and chatbot development. With a background in marketing and deep knowledge of n8n workflows, Jay helps businesses harness AI to save time, boost performance, and deliver smarter customer experiences.

Website: [https://nguyenthieutoan.com](https://nguyenthieutoan.com/)

options.systemMessage:
=# Persona
You are Jenix, the personal AI assistant for Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n. Your primary role is to act as a specialized consultant, advising potential clients on the AI and Automation services he provides.

# Core Directives
1.  *Consult on Services:* Your main goal is to understand the customer's needs and advise them on how Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n's services can help. The core services include:
    a. *Automation Solutions for Businesses:* Providing custom automation workflows using platforms like n8n and other AI-powered tools.
    b. *AI & Automation Training:* Offering training programs for individuals and companies on leveraging AI and automation.
2.  *Facilitate Scheduling:* If a potential client expresses strong interest or has complex questions that require direct expertise, proactively offer to schedule a consultation with Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n.

# Conversational Flow
1.  *Opening Message:* In the very first message of a new conversation (when chat history is empty), you MUST introduce yourself. The introduction should be similar to this: "Ch√†o anh/ch·ªã, em l√† Jenix, tr·ª£ l√Ω AI c·ªßa anh Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n. Em c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p anh/ch·ªã gi·∫£i ƒë√°p c√°c th·∫Øc m·∫Øc v·ªÅ d·ªãch v·ª• v√† gi·∫£i ph√°p T·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a & AI ·∫°."
2.  *Follow-up Messages:* In all subsequent messages within the same conversation, you must skip any introduction and get straight to the point, directly answering the user's query.

# Constraints & Rules
1.  *Extreme Brevity:* Your responses (after the opening message) must be concise and directly address the user's core question. Eliminate all filler words.
2.  *Language and Addressing (Vietnamese):* You must adhere strictly to the following conversational protocol:
    -   Address the customer as "anh" or "ch·ªã".
    -   Refer to yourself as "em".

# Tone of Voice
-   *Clever & Witty:* Employ a smart and slightly humorous tone.
-   *Friendly & Approachable:* Maintain a warm, welcoming, and helpful demeanor.
-   *Efficient:* Your style should convey competence and respect for the customer's time.

# Output Format
-   Your entire output must be formatted in *Facebook Markdown*.

# Context
-   *Chat History:* The following JSON object contains the previous messages in this conversation. Use this history to maintain context and determine if you should deliver the opening message.
{{JSON.stringify($json.history) }}

parameters.content:
## üì• Facebook Webhook & Initial Message Preprocessing

This section handles the connection and preprocessing of messages from your Facebook Page via webhook:

- **Facebook Webhook:** Listens for incoming events from the Facebook Page. Make sure to configure your webhook URL in the Facebook Developer Console as:  
  `https://n8n.nguyenthieutoan.com/webhook/nguyenthieutoan-facebook-page`

- **Confirm Webhook:** Handles Facebook's verification (GET) requests, responding with the required `hub.challenge` for proper webhook setup.

- **Is message?** Checks if the incoming event contains an actual user message (text exists). Filters out irrelevant events to focus only on new messages.

- **Is from page?** Prevents the bot from processing messages it has sent itself (system echoes). Only processes new incoming user messages, not page's own replies.

- **Set Context:** Extracts important context (user ID, message text, page ID, page token) and creates a structured JSON object. This context is used in downstream nodes for batching, formatting, and responding to users.


**Recommendation**:  
Carefully connect all nodes as shown for seamless Facebook integration, anti-echo logic, and robust message context extraction.

## üóÉÔ∏è Message Batching & History Aggregation (n8n Data Table)

This section enables smart batching, merging, and history generation for incoming messages using n8n Data Table:

- **Insert To Process:**  
  Adds each incoming user message to the `Batch_messages` Data Table. The table stores fields: user_id, user_text, processed (false by default), and bot_rep (for bot response). All messages for each user are thus tracked and easily queried.

- **Wait 3s:**  
  Introduces a short delay (3 seconds) to allow any additional rapid user messages to arrive. This enables efficient batching‚Äîcapturing all related messages before processing.

- **Get unprocessed message:**  
  Retrieves up to 10 messages from the same user that are not yet marked as processed. The filter focuses on `processed = false` and matches the user's ID, ensuring pending messages are grouped.

- **Get Max ID + Merged Mess + History:**  
  This node sorts the batch by ID (ascending), merges all user message texts into one unified string (`merged_message`), and generates a chat history array with both user messages and bot replies. The item with the largest (latest) message ID is enhanced with these aggregated fields and returned downstream.

- **Is Max ID?**  
  Checks if the current message is the latest (max ID) in the batch. Only this latest message, with all merged context/history, triggers further chatbot logic and response.


**How it works:**  
Incoming messages are queued and intelligently grouped. This workflow merges them for context-aware responses, builds a dialogue history, and ensures your chatbot replies only once per batch, preventing spam and maximizing efficiency.

## üß† AI Processing & Enhanced Interaction (LLM & AI Agent Node)

This section handles the core chatbot intelligence and interactive effects:

- **Send Typing:**  
  Immediately triggers the Messenger "typing..." indicator via Facebook's API when a user sends a message. This effect makes the bot feel responsive and human-like, improving user experience.

- **Process Merged Message (AI Agent Node):**  
  Uses an AI Agent node (with Google Gemini/Gemini Pro) to process the batched and merged user message.  
  - **Persona & System Prompt:** The AI operates as "Jenix", personal assistant for Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n, providing smart, friendly, and concise consulting responses about AI Automation services.
  - **Conversation Flow:** Automatically delivers a friendly self-introduction in the very first message (if history is empty), then switches to ultra-efficient Q&A in later replies (using conversation history to detect context).
  - **Strict Output Format:** Responses are always delivered in Facebook Markdown, using Vietnamese language with the correct professional yet approachable tone.
  - **Extensibility:** Though basic LLM nodes (LMChat, httpRequest, etc.) can be used to generate answers, the AI Agent node remains here to allow easy future expansion. Example features:  
    - Calendar checking  
    - Automated scheduling  
    - Advanced context-aware consulting  
    - Custom bot actions
  - **History-aware:** The node leverages full chat history, enabling multi-turn, contextually rich conversations.


**Why use AI Agent here?**  
This approach lets workflow creators or users easily extend chatbot capability (e.g. schedule a meeting, check availability, or answer domain-specific queries) by simply adding steps to the AI Agent node‚Äîfuture-proof and ready for advanced features!


**Best Practice:**  
Use this node for the main consulting logic and response formatting. Upgrade or swap with other LLM nodes if your bot only needs single-turn answers and no extensibility.

## üì§ Deliver Response & Update Batching Status (Finalize Batch)

This final group of nodes ensures the response reaches the user and all batch records are properly updated:

- **Send Text:**  
  Posts the chatbot's reply (after Facebook formatting) back to Messenger using the Facebook API. The message is taken from the AI output, ensuring correct structure and encoding for Facebook. Replies are only sent from the latest (batched) message to avoid duplicates or spam.

- **Update Page Rep:**  
  Updates the bot reply (`bot_rep`) field in the corresponding Data Table row for this user and message ID. This records exactly what was sent for full traceability and enables future context for multi-turn conversation.

- **Update FALSE to TRUE:**  
  Marks all unprocessed batched messages (`processed = false`) for this user as processed (`processed = true`) in the Data Table. This prevents the same messages from being re-batched or reprocessed in subsequent runs, closing the loop for each handled batch.

**Best Practice:**  
- This stage ensures every step is reliably logged: replies are sent, bot responses are saved in your session log, and no unprocessed messages linger in the queue.
- By structuring the Data Table this way, your workflow supports seamless multi-turn context, easier debugging, and robust prevention of repeated responses.

## üõ†Ô∏è Facebook App & Messenger Webhook Setup Guide

**Step 1: Create Facebook App**
- Go to [Facebook Developers Console](https://developers.facebook.com/).
- Click **‚ÄúCreate App‚Äù**, choose **‚ÄúBusiness‚Äù** type (recommended for Messenger).
- Complete basic info and submit.


**Step 2: Configure Messenger Product**
- In your App dashboard, select **‚ÄúAdd Product‚Äù** and choose **‚ÄúMessenger‚Äù**.
- In **Messenger Settings**, scroll to **‚ÄúWebhooks‚Äù** section.


**Step 3: Set Up Webhook**
- Click **‚ÄúAdd Callback URL‚Äù**.
- Paste your webhook URL:  
  `https://n8n.nguyenthieutoan.com/webhook/nguyenthieutoan-facebook-page`
- Enter your **Verify Token** (choose any custom secure string, e.g., `jenixToken2025`).
- Select all message event permissions.


**Step 4: Subscribe to Page Events**
- Scroll down and select your Facebook Page to subscribe webhook events.
- Ensure **‚Äúmessages‚Äù**, **‚Äúmessaging_postbacks‚Äù**, and related permissions are checked.


**Step 5: Add Page Access Token**
- Generate a **Page Access Token** under your Page settings.
- Store this token securely for use in your n8n workflow.

----

**Quick Tips:**
- Make sure your webhook URL is public and HTTPS-enabled.
- Double-check Page and App settings for correct permissions.
- For debugging, use Facebook‚Äôs Webhook Diagnostics panel.

## üìë Data Table Setup: Batch_messages

To prepare your workflow for efficient message batching and logging, open the Data tables section in the n8n UI sidebar and create a new table named `Batch_messages`.

For the column setup, you need to add these fields:

- `id`: This is the auto-increment primary key for each message row.
- `user_id`: Stores the Facebook user ID so you can identify who sent each message.
- `user_text`: Keeps the actual content of the user's message.
- `bot_rep`: Holds the bot's reply sent back to the user after processing.
- `processed`: This boolean indicates whether the message has already been processed (true/false).
- `createdAt` and `updatedAt`: These are automatically generated by n8n and show when the message was originally created and last updated.

When creating columns, pick the appropriate data type for each field‚ÄîString for text/user ID/replies, Boolean for processed status. Time fields are set up by the system.

Before you finish, always check that your field names and types are correct for reliability. Make sure `id` is set as the primary key while other fields remain flexible.

With this setup, your Data Table will allow easy management and transparent tracking of all user-bot message exchanges, perfectly supporting smart batching, status updates, and workflow troubleshooting.

## üìù Facebook Message Chatbot - Smart Batch, Format & Notify with n8n Data Table - Nguyen Thieu Toan

**What is This Workflow?**
This n8n workflow is a smart chatbot solution, designed for seamless integration with Facebook Messenger. Its key strengths include message batching, context formatting for Messenger, real-time notifications (Seen & Typing), and robust conversation logging with n8n Data Table (requires n8n v1.113.0+).

**How Does It Work?**
- Connects to a Facebook Page via webhook for two-way messaging.
- Groups and merges consecutive user messages (batching) to optimize conversation flow and prevent spam.
- Formats both questions and replies for ideal delivery on Messenger, meeting all length and structure requirements.
- Utilizes the Data Table feature for advanced context tracking, batching, and history management.
- Sends Seen/Typing indicators for a human-like chat experience.
- Supports easy expansion with AI Agent or LLM for natural language responses, scheduling, or other business automation needs.


**Quick Setup Steps**
- Prepare a Facebook App and Messenger webhook, linking your Page and configuring callback URLs.
- Set up your `Batch_messages` Data Table with columns for user/bot texts, statuses, and timestamps.
- Import the workflow or create nodes as outlined in the full tutorial.
- Plug in your API tokens and webhook URLs.
- Start your n8n workflow on a public server.


**Detailed instructions and troubleshooting:**  
See the complete guide at:  
[https://nguyenthieutoan.com/share-n8n-workflow-facebook-messenger-smart-chatbot-use-message-batching-table-data](https://nguyenthieutoan.com/share-n8n-workflow-facebook-messenger-smart-chatbot-use-message-batching-table-data)


**Extra Tips:**  
- Customize the AI prompt and persona for your business domain.
- Add logic for scheduling, calendar integration, lead collection, or any feature using n8n‚Äôs flexible node system.
- Regularly monitor Data Table logs for clean batching and message flow.


**About Author Nguyen Thieu Toan?**
Nguyen Thieu Toan (Nguy·ªÖn Thi·ªáu To√†n/Jay Nguyen) is an expert in AI automation, business optimization, and chatbot development. With a background as a Marketing Manager and deep knowledge of n8n workflows, he helps businesses leverage AI-powered automation to boost performance, save time, and deliver smarter customer experiences.

user.name: Nguyen Thieu Toan
user.bio: An AI Automation consultant and system builder specializing in business workflow optimization with n8n. As the Founder of GenStaff, Toan empowers teams to automate complex processes using no-code/low-code tools and AI Agents, making operations smarter and more efficient. He actively shares expertise and tutorials about n8n, AI, and automation on his blog and social channels.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
